author: wsjcom
title: If We Insist on Perfection, Memorial Sculpture Is Dead
text:
Karl Rove describes the misguided and uninformed move in nearly 100% Democratic Arcata, Calif., to remove a statue of the surprisingly enlightened Republican President William McKinley from the town square (“The Pitchforks Are Out for McKinley,” op-ed, April 5).
While any town has the right to determine which statues, if any, are to be displayed, the removal of some under the guise of confused historical reasoning may eventually lead to a memorial-free America. While a statue of Mother Teresa might make the cut, certainly...
